title: Associate Director, Quality Assurance - Remote
description:
Reporting to the Director of Medical Device and Combination Product Quality Assurance, the Associate Director Quality Engineering \\& Quality Assurance is responsible for independent compliance support of Medical Devices including the device constituent part of Combination Products. This position will interact with cross functional teams working with all levels of employees. Activities will include developing, documenting, and maintenance of technical business solutions, reviewing and approving medical device/combination product documentation to support regulatory filings and audits of data, policies, procedures, and systems to ensure compliance with Medical Device (21CFR 820s) and Combination Product current Good Manufacturing ruling (21CFR part 4\\), Device Risk Management (ISO 14971\\) and other worldwide regulations and requirements. This position provides Device quality engineering, quality assurance support and leadership to ensure successful quality oversight of prospective medical devices and medical device combination products.
 







**Primary activities include, but are not limited to:** 



* Actively represent Medical Device and Combination Product Quality function on commercial and product/core development teams supporting quality issues related to medical devices or the device constituent of a combination product.
* Review and approve Design Control and Device Risk Management documentation for regulatory filings, clinical supply, development, design transfer qualification and post marketing surveillance. Evaluate deficiencies and assess impact on compliance status.
* Contribute to developing/revising policy and procedures for Medical Device and Combination Product Quality and/or supported areas. Remain informed of industry trends as described in worldwide regulations and industry standards.
* Provide guidance to stakeholders to ensure end\\-to\\-end Design Control principles are implemented effectively.
* Participate in design reviews, CAPA reviews, and ad\\-hoc technical reviews of combination products. Participate in all stages of combination product development including but not limited to oversight of purchasing controls and supplier quality.
* Work with external partners to develop products.
* Review and approve verification/validation test protocols and reports to ensure that the testing is sufficient to meet regulatory requirements and quality objectives.
* Provide input to design and manufacturing documentation including material specifications, drawings, inspection procedures, and manufacturing procedures, to ensure that the resulting products can be adequately manufactured and tested.
* Facilitate translation of customer needs into critical to quality and design input/output requirements, including but not limited to chemical, physical, or performance specifications.
* Lead and manage development of Global Design file (Design History File) deliverables for medical devices







**Skills** 



* Extensive knowledge of applicable medical device regulations (21CFR820, 21CFR Part 4, EU MDR, ISO 13485\\).
* Experience with Design Controls / Corrective Action and Preventive Action / Purchasing Controls as it related to 21CFR820\\.
* Risk Management experience (ISO 1497124971, ICH Q9\\).
* Effective communication skills and working knowledge of device development and commercialization, product approval, and/or regulatory inspection experience with medical devices.
* Must be able to work independently within a cross functional framework and will involve detailed technical writing and review. A high degree of creative thinking, resourcefulness, and networking will be required to coordinate projects or solve problems.
* Ability to work in a matrix organization and effective written and oral communicator.







**Preferred experience and skills:** 



* Remediation experience is desired.
* Knowledge of current Good Manufacturing Practice for combination products.
* Strong understanding of Good Manufacturing Practices, Good Documentation Practices ( Quality Data Portal ); and project management principles is desirable.
* Lean Six Sigma Principles and tools such as: Design of Experiments , Root cause analysis and/or Problem\\-solving methods are desired.
* Experience in applied statistical techniques and the use of root cause analysis
* Certified Lean Six Sigma Green Belt or Black Belt or American Society for Quality (American Society for Quality) certifications are preferred.







**Qualifications:** 



* A Bachelor's degree in (Science or Engineering or associated fields) with a minimum of 7 years related experience OR a Master's degree (Science or Engineering or associated fields) and 5 years related experience or a Ph.D. (Science or Engineering or associated fields) and 3 year of related experience.

title: Actuary I/ II- Cyber
description:
Pay Philosophy
 
 The typical starting salary range for this role is determined by a number of factors including skills, experience, education, certifications and location. The full salary range for this role reflects the competitive labor market value for all employees in these positions across the national market and provides an opportunity to progress as employees grow and develop within the role. Some roles at Liberty Mutual have a corresponding compensation plan which may include commission and/or bonus earnings at rates that vary based on multiple factors set forth in the compensation plan for the role.
 


 Description
 
  
 



 The Global Actuarial Solutions, within Global Risk Solutions (GRS) is looking for a Cyber Actuary to advance the pricing sophistication and profitability of the line of business. This role will focus on the launch and maintenance of our global rater in support of the new global cyber product, aligning pricing strategies across the world. By leveraging the support of Business Segment Actuaries and the Cyber Product organization, the successful Actuary will drive improved pricing and market sensing that results in profit and appropriate growth throughout GRS. Strong expertise in Cyber, as well as advanced pricing techniques, is desired.
 



  
 



 We are open to fill as a Actuary STP I (Grade 19\\)  or Actuary STP II (Grade 20\\) based on candidate experience.
 



  
 



**Responsibilities** 



* Serve as an Actuarial partner and adviser to the Global Cyber team and Product Boards to develop product strategies
* Influence key strategic decisions related to Cyber, such as portfolio design and capital allocation
* Implement and maintain Global Cyber Rater, including Actuarial support for US filings, in collaboration with key stakeholders from product, Business Segment Actuaries, underwriting leads, technology and business agility leads, and operations
* Support Cyber product by contributing to initiatives on portfolio improvement, monitoring etc.
* Coordinate reviews with Cyber Risk Management, and Catastrophe Modeling team to formulate Cyber catastrophe loss ratio that should be used in profitability reviews and planning
* Synthesize and share competitive intelligence and insights on leading indicators to support market cycle sensing and performance monitoring
* Partner with Business Segment Actuaries to develop strategies around technical price and global pricing tool, with consistent pricing standards
* Support Product Planning and associated strategic posturing, as well as provide expertise throughout Financial Planning process
* Champion Cyber strategies with the relevant Actuarial teams, adjusting to local realities as needed
* Work with Cyber\\-focused actuarial leads within GRS businesses to translate global pricing strategies into execution level strategies.
* Responsible for integrated, GRS\\-level narrative across Pricing, Reserving, and Planning, working with Actuarial teams to gather and synthesize information and insights
* Create and maintain a feedback loop between Business Segment Actuaries, Reserving Actuaries, GRS Office of Underwriting, Product Boards and other relevant functions


 Qualifications
 * Bachelor\\`s degree required
* Fellowship in the Casualty Actuarial Society (FCAS) designation.
* Typically 0\\-2 years post\\-fellowship
* Strong Cyber pricing expertise, as well as advanced pricing techniques, is desired.
* Minimum of 7\\-10 years of progressively more responsible experience in an actuarial role.  Minimum 1\\-3 years of Cyber Actuarial experience.
* Requires detailed knowledge of the operations and processes associated with the operational group
* Strong analytical skills with solid understanding of all Cyber actuarial techniques, standards, and assumptions
* This position requires an experienced and knowledgeable actuarial viewpoint in a wide variety of actuarial subjects, and in company, industry, and regulatory practices
* Knowledge should include data, methodologies, systems and platforms
* Advanced to expert knowledge of specialized software, actuarial and statistical methods, tools, and the existence of programming languages
* Able to undertake new processes/analysis based on cutting edge research and technologies, within and outside the insurance industry
* Focus efforts on staying competitive in the market
* Ability to grasp theoretical concepts
* Demonstrated ability to exchange ideas and convey complex information clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing
* Ability to make decisions with incomplete information
* Ability to establish and build effective relationships within and outside the organization
* Ability to give effective training and presentations to senior management and other groups
* Ability to collaborate with Business Segment Actuaries and Office of Underwriting.


 About Us
 
 As a purpose\\-driven organization, Liberty Mutual is committed to fostering an environment where employees from all backgrounds can build long and meaningful careers. Through strong relationships, comprehensive benefits and continuous learning opportunities, we seek to create an environment where employees can succeed, both professionally and personally. 
 



  
 



 At Liberty Mutual, we believe progress happens when people feel secure. By providing protection for the unexpected and delivering it with care, we help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow.  
 



  
 



 We are proud to support a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace, where all employees feel a sense of community, belonging and can do their best work. Our seven Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) offer a centralized, open space to bring employees and allies together to connect, learn and engage.  
 



  
 



 We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well\\-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits  Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.  
 **Fair Chance Notices**

* Los Angeles Unincorporated

* San Francisco

title: Analyst - Commercial Insights and Analytics
description:
**About the Department** 




 The Finance, Insights \\& Enterprise Solutions department brings insights and intelligence to inform decision making \\& drives digitalization and business solutions to attain NNI goals. Finance, Insights \\& Enterprise Solutions works closely across the organization to guide enterprise\\-wide resource allocations, investment choices, drive core operations and develop insights to drive growth and operational excellence across the value chain while innovating for future capabilities. Our focus on innovation ensures we're constantly building future capabilities. We're responsible for regulating accounting, upholding workplace safety, managing our supply chain and sampling, supporting technological and data innovation, insights and analytics, delivering patient support solutions, maintaining our facilities and assuring the integrity and completeness of all business transactions. At Novo Nordisk, you will have the opportunity to build a life\\-changing career in a global business environment. We encourage our employees to make the most of their talent, and we reward hard work and dedication with opportunities for continuous learning and personal development. Are you ready to maximize your potential with us?
 



  
 



**The Position** 




 Provide analytical support by proactively monitoring business developments; provides insights and analytics expertise, primarily through analysis of complex data, to help guide Novo Nordisk on portfolio, franchise, and brand strategy development and execution. Responsible for monitoring market trends, project coordination, and maintaining related tools focused on Novo Nordisk's US cardiometabolic brands and indications. Develop, refine, and update quantitative tracking models and systems, along with documented supporting assumptions to support strategic objectives. Develop communications materials including slides and reports reflecting clear and concise conclusions and recommendations for key stakeholders. Provide support to strategic insights into understanding of patient treatment dynamics and market performance as well as bring ability to triangulate multiple sources to develop innovative solutions to complex, unstructured problems with limited guidance.
 



  
 



**Relationships** 




 Reports to Semaglutide Analytics Director. Working in collaborating with other members of Semaglutide Insight and Analytics Center of Excellence; Internal relationships include close interactions with other cross functional colleagues in Commercial Insights \\& Analytics (CI\\&A), IT, Commercial Strategy and Marketing. External relationships include interactions with external data partners and consultants.
 



  
 



**Essential Functions** 



* Analysis:
	+ Analytical thinker and creative problem solver, ability to influence others with verbal and written communication
	+ Develop presentations with clear storylines, grounded on insights and holistic business concepts and delivers clear conclusions and recommendations founded in rational business sense and own perspective and understanding of findings, stands and defends own position and rational
	+ Demonstrate competencies across descriptive, diagnostic, and predictive analytics
	+ Establish effective partnerships by working closely and collaboratively with business partners and associates to ensure holistic, well designed, and integrated insights to provide pragmatic recommendations based on:
		- thorough analysis of internal and external business issues and environmental factors
		- careful assessment of available data and determination of knowledge gaps
		- translating data and information into trends with business
		- taking initiative and follow\\-through on insights to maximize results and knowledge base
		- Explore new ways to generate analytical insights through understanding of available datasets


* Explore new tools to gain greater efficiencies in deriving analytical insights
* Utilize existing analytic tools including Python, R, Alteryx, etc. to derive insights from complex data sources


* Collaboration
	+ Work seamlessly with other members of the Sema Integrated Analytics Team and Enterprise Analytics
	+ Share learnings with all members of analytics community
	+ Develop close and impactful relationships with data governance, patient privacy, and compliance departments
	+ Effectively work with Data Strategy and IT to ensure data and technical resources are available for data exploration
	+ Develop productive working relationships with Sales Analytics, Marketing Analytics, Advanced Analytics and Market Access Analytics
* Communication
	+ Develop impactful story lines to drive business decision making



  
 



**Physical Requirements** 




 0\\-10% overnight travel required. Approximately 5% overnight travel.
 



  
 



**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor's degree required with focus in Business, Analytics, Math, Science, or Engineering preferred (MBA or advanced degree a plus)
* 1\\-year relevant work experience in commercial pharmaceutical analytics function
* Knowledge and understanding of IQVIA datasets (prior experience with longitudinal patient datasets such as LAAD) and/or other secondary industry sources preferred
* Experience with statistical programming language (SQL, Python, R) preferred
* Experience with BI/visualization tools is required (Tableau, Qlik, Power BI preferred)
* Experience in mathematical modeling for prediction, clustering and classification preferred
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills required
* Ability to organize/manipulate data and see big picture from scattered pieces of information
* Positive and eagerness to learn, collaborate and partner with internal business colleagues
* An innate curiosity is required



  
 



 We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.
 



  
 



 At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
 



  
 



 Novo Nordisk is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by local, state or federal laws, rules or regulations.
 



  
 



 If you are interested in applying to Novo Nordisk and need special assistance or an accommodation to apply, please call us at 1\\-855\\-411\\-5290\\. This contact is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

title: Sr. Analyst, Portfolio Analytics & Credit Research
description:
If you're looking for a meaningful career, you'll find it here at Webster. Founded in 1935, our focus has always been to put people first\\-\\-doing whatever we can to help individuals, families, businesses and our colleagues achieve their financial goals. As a leading commercial bank, we remain passionate about serving our clients and supporting our communities. Integrity, Collaboration, Accountability, Agility, Respect, Excellence are Webster's values, these set us apart as a bank and as an employer.
 







 Come join our team where you can expand your career potential, benefit from our robust development opportunities, and enjoy meaningful work!
 







 Enhance Credit organizations quantitative analytical capabilities: enhance portfolio monitoring capabilities through use of sophisticated analytics. Assist in building bottoms\\-up, credit stress testing framework and dual risk framework.
 







 Support Portfolio Analytics in preparing Portfolio Quality Reviews, (PQR's) and other monthly/quarterly analytics on various business segments throughout the Bank. Provide detailed analysis of both internal Bank data as well as benchmark third party data, coupled with macro\\-economic and industry research. Support strategic initiatives and credit risk management activities as assigned.
 







 Utilize advanced programing skills such as Python, SQL, R and other advanced code writing to enhance Bank portfolio analytics.
 



 Key Responsibilities
 


* Support Portfolio Analytics and Credit Research Team in everyday business functions such as Portfolio Quality Reviews (PQR's), Portfolio Stress Testing, and general credit, macro economic research and sophisticated analytics.
* Collect data sets from multiple sources within the Bank, reconcile and prepare baseline clean data for analysis.
* Incorporate advanced programming such as Python, SQL, and other Machine Learning (AI) programs to collect and produce advanced multi\\-dimensional analytics for various loan portfolios on a quarterly or ad\\-hoc basis.
* Support benchmarking analytics, which includes analysis ranking performance on size, concentration, reserves, delinquencies, and overall performance. Additionally, assess Webster key performance metrics against third party sources such as Trepp, Co Star, LCD, etc.
* Provide data stewardship of third\\-party benchmarking data sources
* Maintain digital delivery of third\\-party benchmarking data feeds on a monthly basis
* Where appropriate, introduce statistical and/or machine learning (AI) techniques to advance data collection and analytic capabilities of overall team
* Research and introduce data visualization software/methods that integrate with coding platforms and could be used to generate graphs/charts for presentations (non\\-excel methods \\-\\- i.e. Matplotlib Python)
* Other portfolio analytics and ad hoc initiatives as assigned.



 Experience
 


* Four (4\\) year BA or BS in Finance, Economics, or Data Analytics or (2\\+) years with a Masters Degree with a quantitative concentration preferred
* 2 \\- 4 years applicable experience in financial modeling, statistical analysis, data analytics, programming, machine learning models \\& AI coding.
* Academic modeling acceptable \\-financial, statistical, machine learning (AI)
* Advanced Excel (i.e. Macros, financial formulas, VBA), SQL, Python, R, OpenAI, PowerPoint, and Word
* Strong analytical skills and ability to multitask with multiple projects on timelines.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills, and ability to express ideas to senior management.
* Ability to apply quantitative techniques in order to analyze portfolio risks
* Ability to analyze massive data sets over various bank portfolios
* Good interpersonal skills.
* Exceptional leadership and organizational skills.







 The estimated base salary range for this position is $90,000 USD to $110,000 USD. Actual salary may vary up or down depending on job\\-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. In addition, this position is eligible for incentive compensation.
 











 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

title: Director, Application Development
description:
Company Details
 




  
 



 Berkley Medical Management Solutions (BMMS) provides a different kind of managed\\-care service for W.R. Berkley Corporation. We believe focusing on an injured worker's successful and speedy return to work is good for people and good for Berkley's insurance operating units. BMMS was first started in 2014 by reimagining the relationship between medical need and technology as a way to deliver the best outcome for injured workers and Berkley's operating units. Our goal was clear: combine solid clinical practices, proven return\\-to\\-work strategies and robust software into one system for seamless management of workers' compensation cases.
 



  
 



 To get it right, we started with a flexible technology platform that allowed for impressive customization without sacrificing the ability for expansion and continued innovation. We deploy integrated systems to give W.R. Berkley Companies recommendations and professional services for managing each individual case in an efficient and appropriate manner. The power of our technology takes medical bill\\-review services and clinical advisory services to a new level. Our unique marriage of technology, software platforms, data analytics and professional services ensures we provide Berkley's operating units with reliable results, and reduced time and expenses associated with case management.
 



  
 


 Responsibilities
 
 Work with Leadership Team to understand their vision and future prospects for the company in terms of new solutions/services to be provided and platform enhancement; Provide Platform and framework recommendations and path toward adoption so as to Align IT strategies communication path between leadership and team members, and articulate vision and roadmap from the business and product leaders to engineers.
 


* Work with Leadership Team to understand their vision and future prospects for the company in terms of new solutions/services to be provided and platform enhancement; Provide Platform and framework recommendations and path toward adoption so as to Align IT strategies communication path between leadership and team members, and articulate vision and roadmap from the business and product leaders to engineers
* Lead and mentor a team of IT Managers and Leads (onsite/offshore);
* Work towards process and architecture improvements, system reliability/monitoring, identify technical debts, prioritize and resolve, compliance towards SOX and other privacy standards, evaluate cloud and/or hybrid technologies; and grow along with team members (mind setting and hands on work); and
* Manage and coordinate hardware and software resources in order to make sure applications run optimally and within the defined SLA (Service Level Agreements).


 Qualifications
 
 Must have a bachelor's degree in computer engineering, Electronic Engineering or related field plus 5 years of experience in the job offered on in any occupation which includes the required experience and skills. Experience must include:
 


* 5 years of experience in software development with at least two (2\\) years in managerial and leadership capacity with a proven track record of engineering management; inclination to coach, mentor and motivate; and strong abilities to lead and develop a broad group of IT resources \\- technical and business focused;
* 5 years of experience working in Agile environment with host of frameworks such as Kanban, Scrum or FDD (Feature Driven Development). Strong orientation towards product/application development keeping organization vision and roadmap in mind, prioritizing user centric perspective. Able to provide strategic vision and direction for IT department, identifying technical debts and working towards a scalable, reliable and state of art software platform
* 3 years of experience in Enterprise grade application architecture and implementation utilizing any of the middleware technologies such as RabbitMQ / AmazonMQ / IBMMQ / Kafka, best practices and hands on integrating with 3rd party vendor solutions using File\\-based (EDI, JSON) and/or API's;
* 3 years of experience working with Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) utilizing different kind of API implementations such as REST / SOAP / GraphQL / Microservices, building and developing using frameworks such as WCF, WebAPI, ASP.NET, Java/J2EE, NodeJS. Working knowledge in API administration tools such as WSO2 / Kong / Mulesoft or others;


* 3 years of experience and implementation of at least one full life cycle project of interactive web/mobile based application utilizing tools such as HTML5 / React / AngularJS / JavaScript. Deep understanding of core OOPS, system design concepts and programming languages such as C\\# / Java or similar;
* 3 years of experience in project management and tracking tools such as Jira / confluence, design tools such as Miro / Visio, hands on and equipped with troubleshooting skills. Familiarity with various continuous integration tools such as Jenkins / Bamboo / Octopus / Docker / Kubernetes and deployment best practices in on\\-prem and cloud environments (Azure/AWS).


 Additional Company DetailsThe Company is an equal employment opportunity employer. We do not accept any unsolicited resumes from external recruiting agencies or firms. The company offers a competitive compensation plan and robust benefits package for full time regular employees Base Salary:$208,936 Benefits: Health, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, Wellness, Paid Time Off, 401(k) and Profit\\-Sharing plans. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment.Additional Requirements Travel Requirements Domestic U.S. travel is required (up to 10% of time) SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: Will supervise 8 employees. JOB LOCATION: Employer's HQ is located in Greenwich, CT. However, candidate may work from home (WFH) office located anywhere in the U.S.Employment Type: OTHER

title: Founding Full-Stack Software Engineer (React Native, Java)
description:
**Summary** 




 \\[Stealth Company] is redefining sports gaming by making it social and free to play. We’re pioneering the next generation of sports gaming with our flagship
 **social sportsbook** 
 , featuring sweepstakes promotions and loyalty rewards. Our mission is to give sports fans fun, dynamic, and risk\\-free alternatives to traditional betting.
 



 We’re looking for a
 **Full\\-Stack Engineer** 
 to join as a
 **Founding Engineer** 
 , playing a pivotal role in shaping our product from the ground up. You’ll work closely with the founders and engineering team (ex\\-Meta and ex\\-Amazon) to design, develop, and deploy critical features that drive our platform forward.
 



 If you’re passionate about technology and thrive in a
 **fast\\-paced, early\\-stage environment** 
 , we’d love to hear from you!
 



**Why Join Us?** 



* Shape the Core Product – No legacy code, no outdated systems. You’ll define the blueprint, not follow one.
* Move Fast, Build Faster – No corporate red tape. You’ll experiment fearlessly, iterate rapidly, and make an immediate impact.
* Ship What Matters – No fluff, no “nice\\-to\\-haves.” Your work will directly impact users and shape the product in real\\-time.
* Own the Outcome – When challenges arise, you don’t wait—you fix them. Take pride in delivering solutions and celebrating the wins along the way.



**You Are Someone With** 



* A Winning Mindset \\& Relentless Drive – You have a champion’s mentality and are willing to go the extra mile. Startups are hard, and you thrive in the challenge.
* An Obsession for Growth – You crave a fast\\-paced environment, continuously push yourself to learn, and refine your craft. You believe you’re in the top 0\\.1% of engineers—or have the drive to get there with the right opportunity.
* A Bias for Ownership – You take on big responsibilities and don’t need a rigid, predictable schedule. You do what it takes to deliver real impact.
* A User\\-First \\& Data\\-Driven Approach – You deeply understand user behavior and make decisions based on data and insights to drive impact.



**Key Responsibilities** 



* Lead the development of complex software systems by writing robust, scalable, and maintainable code. Integrate with APIs, optimize app performance, and uphold the highest quality standards through comprehensive testing and debugging.
* Play a critical role in technical strategy discussions, influencing key decisions, and shaping product/domain architecture with deep expertise in engineering best practices.
* Build front\\-end frameworks that empower product teams to move faster while maintaining high quality and consistency.
* Own the design and implementation of new features, ensuring they are scalable, performant, and secure.
* Collaborate on API design, integrating the frontend with backend services and third\\-party providers.
* Create efficient and reusable front\\-end design systems, ensuring consistency and scalability across the platform—we’re looking for a true CSS artist.
* Collaborate with other founding engineers to build and refine the mobile app—as one of the first team members, you’ll help lay the foundation for the future of our product.
* Define infrastructure as code using Terraform to manage AWS services efficiently.
* Optimize application performance, reliability, and security.



**Skills You Should Have** 




 Must\\-Have
 


* 4\\+ years of experience in software development, with a focus on full\\-stack applications.
* Deep understanding of
 **HTML, CSS, and JavaScript/TypeScript** 
 , with high proficiency in
 **React Native, Relay, and GraphQL** 
 .
* Strong
 **Java/Kotlin** 
 backend experience, including
 **Spring Boot** 
 and microservices architecture.
* Strong understanding of security, authentication, and API design best practices.
* Ability to write clean, maintainable, and scalable code with a focus on performance and reliability.
* Experience building mobile design systems.
* Familiarity with modern front\\-end build pipelines and tooling.
* Strong understanding of UI/UX best practices and principles.
* Proficiency with frontend testing frameworks and backend unit/integration testing.
* Experience in a large technology organization or a fast\\-growing startup.



 Nice\\-to\\-Have
 


* Solid understanding of
 **AWS services** 
 (ECS, Lambda, RDS, DynamoDB, S3, etc.).

title: Database Developer
description:
We are offering a long\\-term contract employment opportunity for a Database Developer in GREENWICH, Connecticut. In this role, you will work closely with our team to understand requirements, plan and track projects, and migrate our system from MySQL to SQL Server.
   

  

 Responsibilities:
   

  

 • Work in collaboration with developers and the Software Architect to comprehend requirements and strategize project plans.
   

 • Take the lead in designing and executing plans for migrating our system from MySQL to SQL Server.
   

 • Compose clean, efficient, and well\\-documented code and scripts.
   

 • Construct a data pipeline from MySQL to SQL Server.
   

 • Oversee and manage the servers of both production and test database environments.
   

 • Cooperate with the team to provide training and establish best practices.
   

 • Set and enforce database parameters, security, audit, and prioritization policies and procedures.
   

 • Manage user accounts, profiles, privileges, roles, and required audit information.
   

 • Conduct audits on database features and versions to ensure licensing compliance across all relevant products.
   

 • Use your skills in Cloud Technologies, Database Object, Informatica, MapR, Microsoft SQL Server, AB Testing, Business Intelligence (BI), Business Requirement Document, Create Dashboards, Data Sources.• Proficiency in Cloud Technologies is required
   

 • Experience with Database Objects is vital
   

 • Familiarity with Informatica is essential
   

 • Working knowledge of MapR is expected
   

 • Proficiency in Microsoft SQL Server is necessary
   

 • Experience in AB Testing is needed
   

 • Knowledge of Business Intelligence (BI) is a key requirement
   

 • Ability to create a Business Requirement Document is expected
   

 • Skills to create Dashboards are crucial
   

 • Familiarity with various Data Sources is a must

title: Technical Support Specialist
Senior Software Engineer, GenAI Allocation
description:
**About Scale** 




 At Scale AI, our mission is to accelerate the development of AI applications. For 8 years, Scale has been the leading AI data foundry, helping fuel the most exciting advancements in AI, including: generative AI, defense applications, and autonomous vehicles. With our recent Series F round, we're accelerating the abundance of frontier data to pave the road to Artificial General Intelligence (AGI), and building upon our prior model evaluation work with enterprise customers and governments, to deepen our capabilities and offerings for both public and private evaluations.
 



**About Data Engine** 




 Our Generative AI Data Engine powers the world's most advanced LLMs and generative models through world\\-class RLHF (Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback), human data generation, model evaluation, safety, and alignment. The data we are producing is some of the most important work for how humanity will interact with AI.
 



**About our Allocation team** 




 The allocation team is core to the contributor experience at Scale\\-they are the team responsible for powering the recommendation engine used to serve available work to contributors. They focus on optimizing the recommendations contributors can choose from to find the work that best fits their skill set, preferences, and the needs of Scale's business.
 


**Responsibilities:** 
* Own large areas within our product
* Build features end\\-to\\-end: front\\-end, back\\-end, system design, debugging and testing
* Deliver experiments at a high velocity and level of quality to engage our customers
* Work across the entire product lifecycle from conceptualization through production
* Influence the culture, values, and processes of a growing engineering team
* Inspire and mentor less experienced engineers
* Collaborating with cross\\-functional teams to define, design, and ship new product features and experiences.


**Requirements:** 
* 5\\+ years of relevant experience is preferred
* Track record of shipping high\\-quality products and features at scale
* Desire to work in a very fast\\-paced environment
* Ability to turn business and product ideas into engineering solutions
* Excellent problem\\-solving skills, and be able to work independently or as part of a team.
* Excited to join a dynamic, hybrid team in either San Francisco or New York City






*Compensation packages at Scale for eligible roles include base salary, equity, and benefits. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position, determined by work location and additional factors, including job\\-related skills, experience, interview performance, and relevant education or training. Scale employees in eligible roles are also granted equity based compensation, subject to Board of Director approval. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process, and confirm whether the hired role will be eligible for equity grant. You'll also receive benefits including, but not limited to: Comprehensive health, dental and vision coverage, retirement benefits, a learning and development stipend, and generous PTO. Additionally, this role may be eligible for additional benefits such as a commuter stipend.* 





 Please reference the job posting's subtitle for where this position will be located. For pay transparency purposes, the base salary range for this full\\-time position in the locations of San Francisco, New York, Seattle is:
 

 $188,000—$225,600 USD
 




***PLEASE NOTE:***
*Our policy requires a 90\\-day waiting period before reconsidering candidates for the same role. This allows us to ensure a fair and thorough evaluation of all applicants.* 




**About Us:** 




*At Scale, we believe that the transition from traditional software to AI is one of the most important shifts of our time. Our mission is to make that happen faster across every industry, and our team is transforming how organizations build and deploy AI. Our products power the world's most advanced LLMs, generative models, and computer vision models. We are trusted by generative AI companies such as OpenAI, Meta, and Microsoft, government agencies like the U.S. Army and U.S. Air Force, and enterprises including GM and Accenture. We are expanding our team to accelerate the development of AI applications.* 




*We believe that everyone should be able to bring their whole selves to work, which is why we are proud to be an affirmative action employer and inclusive and equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability status, gender identity or Veteran status.* 




*We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation in the application or recruiting process due to a disability, please contact us at accommodations@scale.com. Please see the United States Department of Labor's* 
*Know Your Rights poster* 
*for additional information.* 




*We comply with the United States Department of Labor's* 
*Pay Transparency provision* 
*.* 




***PLEASE NOTE:** 
 We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of job opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants' needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data. Please see our privacy policy for additional information.*

title: Test Automation Engineer - US Remote
VP, Product Manager
description:
RAPP New York is looking for a VP, Product Manager to join our Corporate team.
 
**WHO WE ARE:** 




 We are RAPP \\- world leaders in activating growth with precision and empathy at scale.
 



 As aglobal, next\\-generation precision marketing agencywe leveragedata, creativity, technology, and empathyto foster client growth.We champion individuality in the marketing solutions we create, and in our workplace. We fight for solutions that adapt to the individual's needs, beliefs, behaviors, and aspirations.
 



 We foster an inclusive workplace that values diversity and emphasizes personal well\\-being.
 



**HOW WE DO IT:** 




 At RAPP, our fearless superconnectors help tocreate value from personal brand experiences by focusing on three key areas: connected data, connected content and connected decisioning.
   

  

 Our data analysts identify who that person is, our strategists understand what they want, and our award\\-winning technologists and creatives know how to deliver it \\- ensuring we're able to activate authentic customer connections for our clients.
   

  

 Part of Omnicom's Precision Marketing Group, RAPP is comprised of 2,000\\+ creatives, technologists, strategists, and data and marketing scientists across 15\\+ global markets.
 



**YOUR ROLE:** 




 We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Product Manager to guide the development and enhancement of two core software products that will form the core of a future, integrated software suite for marketing agencies and their clients. You will work in close partnership with SVP Global Productized Services, who defines the overarching product strategy and delivery from a business perspective. This role's primary focus will be on ensuring the products are sustainable, modular, and extensible, while aligning the efforts of UX, design, and development teams to these goals. Proficiency in Agile and Scrum methodologies\\-particularly in driving time to value for end users\\-is paramount. Familiarity with API\\-first web architectures is essential, and exposure to generative AI and Large Language Models (LLMs) is a strong plus.
 



**YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:** 



1. **Product Sustainability, Modularity \\& Extensibility**


* Own the architectural roadmap to ensure the products are built for
 **long\\-term sustainability** 
 and
 **flexibility** 
 .
* Define and champion
 **best practices** 
 around modular design, extensible APIs, and scalable infrastructure.
* Collaborate with the business sponsor to turn high\\-level business strategy into
 **actionable product roadmaps** 
 that support a multi\\-product suite.


- **Agile Product Management \\& Time to Value**

* **Lead Agile/Scrum ceremonies** 
 (daily stand\\-ups, sprint planning, reviews, retrospectives) with offshore and vendor teams to optimize the delivery cadence and ensure efficient collaboration.
* Establish clear, measurable objectives for each sprint to maximize
 **time to value** 
 , balancing business needs with technical feasibility.
* Continuously iterate on and refine the product backlog to maintain momentum, prioritize high\\-impact features, and adapt to changing business conditions.


- **Alignment with Business \\& Stakeholders**

* Work closely with the SVP Global productized services to translate strategic goals and capabilities into requirements and
 **day\\-to\\-day priorities** 
 for UX, design, and development teams.
* Manage and facilitate ongoing communication with the Strategic stakeholders within the global leadership (CTO, Chief Strategy Officer, Chief Transformation Officer) to
 **validate requirements** 
 and
 **product direction** 
 .
* Provide
 **weekly updates** 
 on product progress, highlighting key decisions, trade\\-offs, and successes.


- **Multi\\-Product Roadmap \\& Integration**

* Develop a
 **clear product roadmap** 
 for
 **two core products** 
 , ensuring they can be seamlessly expanded into a larger, integrated software solution.
* Coordinate efforts across multiple teams to align
 **timelines, deliverables, and feature sets** 
 .
* Develop a release calendar based on the product roadmap, deliver the product to this release calendar
* Advocate for
 **API\\-first** 
 methodologies to maximize interoperability with other solutions and external platforms.


- **Cross\\-Functional Leadership**

* Guide UX, design, and development teams to ensure all work adheres to the strategic imperatives of
 **sustainability, modularity, and extensibility** 
 .
* Translate product requirements into
 **well\\-defined user stories** 
 and acceptance criteria, keeping engineering and design teams focused on
 **high\\-value deliverables** 
 .
* Oversee the entire product development lifecycle\\-from discovery and design through iterative development, testing, and release\\-using
 **Agile** 
 best practices.


- **User Experience \\& Adoption**

* Drive
 **user\\-centric research** 
 and usability testing to validate that product features address real\\-world needs of agencies and clients, with groups within the agency
* Partner with UI/UX teams to ensure product interfaces are
 **intuitive** 
 and
 **easily adoptable** 
 for diverse agency and client user groups
* Develop and execute structured
 **onboarding** 
 and
 **training** 
 strategies that encourage strong user engagement and retention.


- **Performance Tracking \\& Optimization**

* Define and monitor
 **key performance indicators (KPIs)** 
 to measure product success, particularly in terms of
 **extensibility, modular design** 
 , and
 **time to value** 
 .
* **Measure sprint burndown** 
 and budget use against product deliverables
* Use data analysis to identify trends, validate product decisions, and inform iterative enhancements.
* Present product performance insights to leadership, highlighting opportunities for
 **further innovation** 
 and optimization.


- **Risk Management \\& Compliance**

* Identify and manage
 **dependencies, risks, and challenges** 
 that could affect product sustainability, time\\-to\\-market, or overall value delivery.
* Ensure product compliance with
 **industry regulations** 
 (including data privacy and security standards) and specific contractual obligations are upheld.



**REQUIRED SKILLS:** 



* Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Maths, Computer Science, or a related field; an MBA or Master's degree is a plus.
* **5\\+ years of hands\\-on product management experience** 
 , preferably with B2B SaaS or enterprise software.
* Proven success in full\\-lifecycle product management\\-from
 **ideation to launch** 
 , iteration, and eventual scale\\-up.
* Demonstrated ability to manage multiple product lines or modules, with a focus on creating interoperable solutions.
* Experience of managing offshore development partners and teams successfully
* **In\\-depth knowledge of Agile and Scrum** 
 frameworks and best practices.
* Experience with planning and executing sprints, sprint retrospectives, and maintaining product backlogs to ensure the team delivers maximum value quickly.
* Track record of effectively balancing
 **time to value** 
 with stakeholder requirements, resource constraints, and product quality.
* **Required experience in a media or digital function** 
 , whether within an advertising/marketing agency or on the client side.
* Understanding of
 **campaign management** 
 , digital marketing workflows, and the agency\\-client relationship.
* Skilled at translating
 **business requirements into technical workflows** 
 that emphasize modular, extensible design.
* Familiarity with
 **API\\-first** 
 architectures and modern web technologies, ensuring products are ready for
 **seamless integration** 
 .
* Exposure to
 **generative AI** 
 and
 **Large Language Models (LLMs)** 
 (e.g., ChatGPT, GPT\\-4\\) is highly advantageous.
* Competent in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, BI platforms) to inform product decisions and measure impact.
* Experience setting and measuring against
 **metrics (KPIs, OKRs)** 
 to drive continuous improvement and demonstrate product ROI.
* **Excellent communication** 
 , presentation, and collaboration abilities to coordinate efforts among business sponsors, leadership, and cross\\-functional teams.
* Solid
 **project management** 
 skills, with the capacity to handle multiple workstreams under tight timelines.
* A proactive, solutions\\-oriented mindset that thrives in
 **dynamic environments** 
 and consistently drives results.
* **Matrix management** 
 of stakeholders at all levels of seniority within the organization




---



**Our Hybrid Work Model:** 




 RAPP's current hybrid model is designed to enable in\\-person connections and collaboration that is core to our culture, while also supporting flexibility for all employees. As such, we have the option to work from home two days per week, if we'd like.
 



**RAPP provides a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits plan. Benefits for this role include health/vision/dental insurance, 401(k), stock options, Healthcare \\& Dependent Flexible Spending Accounts, vacation, sick, and personal days and positive activism days, paid parental leave and disability benefits. For more information regarding Omnicom benefits, please visitwww.omnicombenefits.com.**

title: Production Lead
description:
**Medical Laboratory Manufacturing Company URGENTLY hiring Production Line Leads in Allendale, NJ \\& Oakland, NJ!!** 

***Career Opportunity, please apply and can be set up with an interview within the same week of applying and start the following week!***




**Location:** 
  Allendale or Oakland, NJ
 



**Position:** 
  Production Line Lead
 



**Shift:** 
 7:00am—3:30pm (Monday\\-Friday)
 



**Pay:** 
 $28\\-$31/hour ; Overtime: $42\\-$46\\.50/hour
 






 Job Description
 
 We are seeking a dedicated Blister Packaging Line Leader to oversee and fill the packaging area. This role involves supervising a packaging team responsible for filling, pouching, and blister packaging operations. The ideal candidate will ensure adherence to cGMP's, safety regulations, and environmental requirements, while also managing training, quality records, and daily productivity.
 






 Responsibilities
 * Supervise packaging team responsible for filling, pouching, and blister packaging operations.
* Ensure adherence to cGMP's, safety regulations, and environmental requirements.
* Ensure assigned personnel are effectively trained in their job requirements.
* Ensure quality records, including logbooks and procedures, are completed.
* Assist in the packaging of products in accordance with Batch Records and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
* Monitor and report daily output and productivity of the team.
* Schedule, delegate, and execute weekly and daily packaging schedules to support business needs.
* Monitor and control production costs.
* Implement process improvements with emphasis on quality, safety, and cost reduction.
* Support the transfer of manufacturing processes from R\\&D to commercial launch.
* Investigate quality issues and prepare investigation reports (CARs).
* Write and revise Batch Records and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
* Prepare and track required GMP documents (ECOs, Process Deviations, Product Dispositions).
* Maintain adequate inventory to prevent backorders and excessive production costs.
* Prepare Annual Product reports and Quarterly trending.
* Initiate action to prevent the occurrence of nonconformities.
* Maintain supplies and requisition as needed.
* Perform performance management for all assigned personnel.


 Essential Skills
 * Pharmaceutical manufacturing experience
* Production supervision
* Experience in GMP Environment
* Ability to read and follow SOPs
* Bachelor's Degree in related field
* Experience in document control, inspection, and cleanroom environments
* Supervision and production management skills


 Additional Skills \\& Qualifications
 * GED/high school diploma PLUS four (4\\) years of medical device, pharmaceutical, or food/beverage packaging experience
* Bachelor’s degree in engineering or sciences with 2 years of medical device, pharmaceutical, or food/beverage packaging experience
* Strong people management and leadership skills
* Ability to motivate staff
* Experience with ERP systems is preferred
* Ability to work in a team environment
* Experience with maintaining and managing packaging equipment is a plus
* Strong organizational skills
* Excellent communication skills (oral and written)
* Experience with Microsoft software applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)






 Work Environment
 
 This role operates in a clean room environment at our Allendale, NJ facility. The work hours are from 7am to 3:30pm. The physical demands include occasional standing, walking, sitting, using hands to handle objects, climbing stairs, and lifting or moving supplies up to 50 pounds.
 


 Pay and Benefits
 
 The pay range for this position is $28\\.00 \\- $31\\.00/hr.
 



 Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to specific elections, plan, or program terms. If eligible, the benefits available for this temporary role may include the following:
   

  

 • Medical, dental \\& vision
   

 • Critical Illness, Accident, and Hospital
   

 • 401(k) Retirement Plan – Pre\\-tax and Roth post\\-tax contributions available
   

 • Life Insurance (Voluntary Life \\& AD\\&D for the employee and dependents)
   

 • Short and long\\-term disability
   

 • Health Spending Account (HSA)
   

 • Transportation benefits
   

 • Employee Assistance Program
   

 • Time Off/Leave (PTO, Vacation or Sick Leave)
 






 Workplace Type
 
 This is a fully onsite position in Oakland,NJ.
 






 Application Deadline
 
 This position is anticipated to close on Feb 19, 2025\\.
